ASSESSING.Defintion: to judge or decide the amount, value, quality, or importance of something

BACKSIDES.Defintion: the part of the body that you sit on

BETTER OFF.Defintion: to have more money than you had in the past or more money than most other people

BUREAUCRACY.Defintion: a system for controlling or managing a country, company, or organisation that is operated by a large number of officials employed to follow rules carefully

COMPELLING.Defintion: if a reason, argument, etc. is compelling, it makes you believe it or accept it because it is so strong

COUNTER ARGUMENT.Defintion: an argument against another argument, idea, or suggestion

COUNTERACT.Defintion: to reduce or remove the effect of something unwanted by producing an opposite effect

DEEMED.Defintion: considered or judged in a particular way

ENTREPRENEURS.Defintion: people who starts their own business, especially when this involves seeing a new opportunity

EXTENSIVELY.Defintion: in a way that covers a large area or has a great range

FACTOR IN.Defintion: to include something when you are doing a calculation, or when you are trying to understand something

GET BY.Defintion: to be able to live or deal with a situation with difficulty, usually by having just enough of something you need, such as money

HANDOUT.Defintion: something such as food, clothing, or money that is given free to someone who has a great need for it

IMPLEMENTING.Defintion: to start using a plan or system

INCENTIVE.Defintion: something that encourages a person to do something

INFLATION.Defintion: a general, continuous increase in prices

LIBERTARIANS.Defintion: people who believe that people should be free to think and behave as they want and should not have limits put on them by governments

MAJORITY.Defintion: the larger number or part of something

NEOLIBERAL.Defintion: supporting a large amount of freedom for markets, with little government control or spending, and low taxes

OUTSPOKEN.Defintion: expressing strong opinions very directly without worrying if other people are offended

PERSUASIVE.Defintion: to make someone do or believe something by giving them a good reason to do it or by talking to that person and making them believe it

POVERTY LINE.Defintion: the official level of income that is needed to achieve a basic living standard with enough money for things such as food, clothing, and a place to live

PROGRAMMERS.Defintion: people whose job is to produce computer programs

PROPONENT.Defintion: a person who speaks publicly in support of a particular idea or plan of action

PUSHING FOR.Defintion: to demand something repeatedly, or to take strong action to try to make it happen

REGARDLESS.Defintion: despite; not being affected by something

SHAREHOLDERS.Defintion: people who own shares in a company and therefore get part of the company's profits and the right to vote on how the company is controlled

SHAREHOLDINGS.Defintion: the shares in a company that a particular person or organization owns considered together as a unit

SIGNATURE.Defintion: used to refer to the special thing for which a person or place is particularly known

SPECTRUM.Defintion: a range of different positions, opinions, etc. between two extreme points

TOP-UP.Defintion: an extra amount of something, especially money, that is added to an existing amount to create the total you need

TOUCHED ON.Defintion: to mention a subject quickly when speaking or writing about another subject

TRACTION.Defintion: the fact of an idea, product, etc. becoming popular or being accepted

VEHEMENTLY.Defintion: in a strong and emotional way

VICIOUS CIRCLE.Defintion: a continuing unpleasant situation, created when one problem causes another problem that then makes the first problem worse

VICIOUS CYCLE.Defintion: a continuing unpleasant situation, created when one problem causes another problem that then makes the first problem worse

WELFARE.Defintion: a system of payments made by the government to people who are ill, poor, or who have no job

WIDESPREAD.Defintion: existing or happening in many places and/or among many people
